meaningMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>resistant</kanji>. If you're resisting things, then you're enduring and withstanding them. That's why this is <vocabulary>to endure</vocabulary> and <vocabulary>to withstand</vocabulary>.
readingMnemonic: What is it that you have <vocabulary>to endure</vocabulary>? A barrage of <reading>ta</reading>cos (た), coming at you.
